programme.desc: El chef Ramsay viaja a Filadelfia, Pensilvania, para visitar Hot Potato Cafe. Encuentra a un dueño agotado por la pasión que ha creado un ambiente tóxico lleno de negatividad.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Ramsay descubre que el restaurante mexicano Mama Rita's sufre de una cocina desorganizada. Mientras tanto, la dueña puede tener que sacrificar una amistad para salvar su negocio.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay encuentra una segunda ubicación fallida de un restaurante familiar.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay visita Lido di Manhattan, un local italiano con una cocina antiestética y un propietario sin experiencia. Está tan horrorizado que cierra el lugar temporalmente.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay pasa por un restaurante francés y descubre que él y el jefe de cocina tienen una formación culinaria similar. Sin embargo, el chef niega la mala calidad de la comida de su restaurante.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay visita Anna Vincenzo's, un restaurante familiar en Boca Raton, Florida. Se entera de que el obstinado dueño no acepta el cambio. Después de que se ignoran sus ideas, Ramsay se marcha.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visita Fleming, un restaurante danés en Miami. El obstinado dueño no quiere actualizar el lugar y Ramsay descubre algo en la hielera que lo lleva a cerrar el restaurante.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visita el Pabellón Español en Nueva Jersey. Descubre que un par de hermanos en disputa están llevando el restaurante al suelo. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay llega a un restaurante endeudado propiedad de dos ex meseras y las cosas están tan mal que Ramsay realiza una intervención para abordar el tema del liderazgo.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: PJ's Steakhouse se está muriendo por la falta de control de la gerencia en la calidad de la comida, con un dueño un poco grosero y su esposo, el copropietario, sentados en el bar bebiendo todo el día.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay hace el viaje a Carlstadt, Nueva Jersey, para visitar Grasshopper Also, un restaurante que ha visto días mejores. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Viajando al North End de Boston, el chef Ramsay pasa una semana en Davide, un restaurante italiano mal administrado por hermanos enemistados. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay viaja a Providence, Rhode Island, para visitar DownCity, un restaurante con un avance detenido por un propietario obstinado y de mal genio. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Mientras está en Bridgeport, Connecticut, el chef Ramsay visita el Café Tavolini. Dos propietarios indiferentes observan cómo su restaurante se va a la ruina . Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The series starts in autumnal Bordeaux. Rick arrives just in time to judge a local wine contest, and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein enjoys a winter break in Reykjavik in search of the perfect cod and sampling succulent fjord-reared roast lamb.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick enjoys a weekend in Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell enticingly side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall teems today with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire. It is home to comfort dishes like tafelspitz and goulash, and it also gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes, the wiener schnitzel.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits Bologna in northern Italy, a city so famous for its food that it's known as the stomach of Italy. He learns how to make the local fresh egg pasta used for tortellini, tagliatelle, ravioli and lasagne.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The second heat of the competition takes the action to Crawley in the south of England. Winners and losers from Heat One face fresh opponents, fighting to secure a win and guarantee their place in the finals.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: It is the last chance for teams to secure a spot before the final as they clash in one-on-one matches for a place in the top 16. New robots join the fray, hoping for a last-minute victory to advance to the championship.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The most battle-hardened combat robots in the UK compete in the MechMania Grand Final. After three heats, the tournament switches to a one-on-one sudden-death format until one team emerges as the victor.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A new spinner has something to prove and a family team pour blood, sweat and tears into keeping their robot wars dream alive. The robots compete through brutal group battles and fierce head to heads for a place in the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: City Hunter: Bay City Wars

programme.title: Fuse: Memoirs of the Hunter Girl

programme.title: Millennium Actress [Japanese-Language Version]

programme.title: Napping Princess [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: The sci-fi fantasy Napping Princess shows that following your dreams is sometimes the best way to discover your past. While she should be studying, Kokone often dozes off, entering a dream-world called Heartland.

programme.title: DEEMO Memorial Keys
programme.desc: Deemo lives in a castle all by herself and one day, a little girl falls from the sky. Alice doesn't remember anything about her past and Deemo tries to help her. A tree begins to grow whenever the piano plays, weaving a mystery.

programme.title: Adolescence of Utena
programme.desc: Utena Tenjou, a mysterious transfer student, gets drawn into duels at the Ohtori Academy to win the hand of the Rose Bride and the power to bring on a revolution in this retelling of the surrealist shoujo classic.

programme.title: Bleach: Memories of Nobody
programme.desc: Ichigo and his fellow Soul Reapers must save two worlds from annihilation.

programme.title: The Sentinel

programme.title: Stolen
programme.desc: A former thief frantically searches for his missing daughter, who has been kidnapped and locked in the trunk of a taxi. Starring Nicolas Cage and Malin Akerman.

programme.title: Cold Souls: Cold Souls

programme.title: Mail Order Monster
programme.desc: A girl seeks help and guidance from a robot monster to cope with the bullies at school and her father's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Grace and Goliath
programme.desc: Hollywood big-shot Josh Jenkins sweeps into Belfast to make a movie, but before long his world crashes and he loses everything. Hotel cleaner Lily invites him to stay with her family and gradually the people of this 'strange' city touch his heart forever.

programme.title: Kids From Planet 62F
programme.desc: Four friends find an object with special powers that belongs to two alien kids from the planet 62F. Now they must race to get it back to its rightful owners, but NASA are on their tail and they will stop at nothing to get their hands on it.

programme.title: Switched
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied, Cassandra Evans prays that her nemesis, Katie Sharp, the queen bee of social media, would know what it's like to walk a day in her shoes. Her prayer is answered in an unexpected way when they get "Switched."

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E: A.R.C.H.I.E
programme.desc: Isabel has recently lost her parents in a car accident. Feeling alone and friendless, she befriends a stray robot dog named A.R.C.H.I.E. who can talk, run at blinding speed and has super strength and x-ray vision and they become fast friends.

programme.title: Captain Sabertooth
programme.desc: The orphan boy Pinky follows the Captain on an exciting and dangerous journey across the big oceans to the kingdom of Lama Rama, hunting for a treasure and the answer to who is Pinky's father.

programme.title: F.R.E.D.I.
programme.desc: Prepare for an adventure that's out of this world! When an intelligent, lovable robot, known as F.R.E.D.I., goes missing from a secret government research facility it's found by 15 year old James.

programme.title: The Sorcerer's Apprentice
programme.desc: Ben Clark yearns to learn magic from his new neighbor, Milner. Milner hesitates to help Ben because he carries the same scar as the original bearer of an ancient staff that was wielded in the battle between good and evil 1,400 years ago.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
programme.desc: One of puppet-maker Geppetto's creations, a puppet called Pinocchio, magically comes to life. In order to become a real boy, Pinocchio must go on a daring adventure and learn valuable lessons.

programme.title: Scales
programme.desc: Mermaids are real! Siren has lived her whole life thinking she's an ordinary girl, but on the eve of her 12th birthday she learns that she is destined to become a mermaid. She must say goodbye to her entire life as she transitions into the water.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bait and Switch (Finale Part 1)
programme.desc: It's the final week of the season and Hard Merchandise holds a narrow lead over the fleet

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: There are less than five days left before the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season in Gloucester, Massachusetts closes and the competition will come downto the very last day of fishing

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Masters of Bluefin (Special)
programme.desc: Take a look back at the best moments from previous seasons as the top fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for supremacy while they pursue the elusive Atlantic Bluefin Tuna

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Something to Prove
programme.desc: The best fishermen from Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out on the first day of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna and Tequila
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and Erin & Sarah, the father/daughter fishing operation from Portland, Maine, try to keep their lead over the Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: May the Fish Be with You
programme.desc: It's week three of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, one captain is forced to choose between two friends on the water.
programme.sub-title: May the Fish Be with You

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: It's week four of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and tensions start to boil for Wicked Pissah's new crew, while two rival harpoon boats face off.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Big Hauls and Downfalls
programme.desc: It's week five of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and teamwork is the name of the game for Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Help Wanted
programme.desc: Sharks, shorts and crew problems plague the fleet, but two captains get blessed with new mates while harpoon boats battle for the last fish of their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Snitches Get Fishes
programme.desc: Midway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, a long-­-running feud lands one Gloucester captain in hot water, while another boat struggles to keep their crew intact.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Opposites Distract
programme.desc: At the halfway mark of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season some teams are working well together and killing it while others are floundering and on the verge of killing each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Take It to the Bank
programme.desc: The Gloucester captains face a familiar decision: whether or not to take the long, high-¬-risk journey to Georges Bank to increase their chances of a big bluefin haul.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Doubling Down
programme.desc: After a massive haul offshore on Georges Bank last week, Captain Dave Carraro of FV-¬-Tuna.com and Captain TJ Ott of Hot Tuna decide to double down and make the long trip again.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Riders in the Storm
programme.desc: When a violent storm rolls in during week eleven, the Gloucester captains face a tough decision at a critical time: do they fish... or flee?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Comeback Kid
programme.desc: With four weeks left in the season, Hard Merchandise and FV-¬- Tuna.Com struggle to stay at the top of the fleet as an unexpected adversary, the Wicked Pissah.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Invaders
programme.desc: With only three weeks left, the North Atlantic captains face more competition than ever as boats from all over head to Gloucester and battle for those last bluefin of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Thin Bluefin Line
programme.desc: There is a narrow margin separating the top four boats and only two weeks left in the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Final Fishdown
programme.desc: In the last week of the Atlantic bluefin tuna season, the closest race in Wicked Tuna history is a tossup among four top contenders.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Something to Prove
programme.desc: The best fishermen from Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out on the first day of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna and Tequila
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and Erin & Sarah, the father/daughter fishing operation from Portland, Maine, try to keep their lead over the Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Connect the World

programme.desc: A fresh and inclusive take on the top stories from Africa, Europe and beyond, giving every continent an equal voice.

programme.desc: A fresh and inclusive take on the top stories from Africa, Europe and beyond, giving every continent an equal voice.

programme.title: What We Know With Max Foster
programme.desc: Max Foster brings a definitive round-up of the day's top stories, giving you the urgent need-to-know context and diving deeper into the questions sparking debate around the world.

programme.title: Quest Means Business
programme.desc: Richard Quest presents a round-up of the day's global business news with a focus on international business and market trends.

programme.title: The Lead With Jake Tapper
programme.desc: Covering all the day's top stories around the country and the globe, from politics to money, sports to popular culture.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: Highlights and action from the world's sporting competitions.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: Anchor Erin Burnett presents information beyond the regular headlines by providing objective reports on top issues along with compelling interviews, lively debates and in-depth analysis of situations.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper 360
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper brings his prickly but often witty perspective to current events and personalities in the news. He is joined by a series of guests that frequently include political and legal analysts.

programme.title: The Source With Kaitlan Collins
programme.desc: Kaitlan Collins chases the facts, asks the tough questions and connects with her sources on prime time to break down the day's biggest news stories.

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars as a former army officer who sets out on a mission of revenge to confront the man who tormented him while he was a prisoner at a Japanese labor camp during World War II.

programme.title: This Must Be The Place
programme.desc: Cheyenne (Sean Penn), a retired rock star living off his royalties in Dublin, returns to New York City to find the Nazi responsible for humiliating his recently deceased father during WWII.

programme.desc: Several years after his childhood friend, a violin prodigy, disappears on the eve of his first solo concert, an Englishman travels throughout Europe to find him.

programme.title: The Breadwinner
programme.desc: A headstrong young girl in Afghanistan disguises herself as a boy in order to provide for her family.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.

programme.title: Florida Project, The
programme.desc: Set over one summer, the film follows precocious 6-year-old Moonee as she courts mischief and adventure with her ragtag playmates and bonds with her rebellious but caring mother, all while living in the shadows of Disney World.

programme.title: American Honey
programme.desc: A teenage girl with nothing to lose joins a traveling magazine sales crew, and gets caught up in a whirlwind of hard partying.

programme.title: 20th Century Women
programme.desc: 20th Century Women is a poignant love letter to the people who raise us – and the times that form us – as this makeshift family forges fragile connections that will mystify and inspire them through their lives.

programme.title: Free State of Jones
programme.desc: Free State of Jones is an epic action-drama set during the Civil War, and tells the story of defiant Southern farmer, Newt Knight (McConaughey), and his extraordinary armed rebellion against the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Outsider
programme.desc: Revolves around a British military contractor Lex Walker who is told his daughter has died. When he arrives in Los Angeles and discovers the body is not hers, he begins an investigation.

programme.title: First Kill
programme.desc: A Wall Street broker is forced to evade a police chief investigating a bank robbery as he attempts to recover the stolen money in exchange for his son's life.

programme.title: Black Butterfly
programme.desc: Paul (Antonio Banderas), a down-on-his-luck screenwriter picks up a drifter (Rhys Meyers) and offers him a place to stay. However, when the stranger takes Paul hostage and forces him to write, their unhinged relationship brings buried secrets to light.

programme.title: Robert the Bruce
programme.desc: Injured and on the run, an outlaw king sets out to win Scotland’s long awaited freedom from England and reclaim his throne.

programme.title: The Outsider
programme.desc: Revolves around a British military contractor Lex Walker who is told his daughter has died. When he arrives in Los Angeles and discovers the body is not hers, he begins an investigation.

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: The most dangerous hitman in the world, Arthur Bishop thought he had put his murderous past behind him when his most formidable foe kidnaps the love of his life.

programme.title: #1 Cheerleader Camp
programme.desc: A pair of horny college guys get summer jobs at a sexy cheerleader camp.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: Based on a true story, ten fishermen from Cornwall are signed by Universal Records and achieve a top ten hit with their debut album of sea shanties.

programme.title: The Big Divorce
programme.desc: Mike Christian is a happily married man who runs into his high school sweetheart Alex and sparks still fly. Mike is determined Alex is his true soul mate, but he signed an iron-clad pre-nuptial agreement and his wife will not let him out of the marriage.

programme.title: BUFFALOED
programme.desc: Set in the underworld of debt-collecting, overachiever and hustler Peg Dahl (Zoey Deutch), finds quick success, making her the target of a violent competitor.

programme.title: Austenland
programme.desc: A woman who is obsessed with "Pride and Prejudice" travels to a Jane Austen theme park in search for her perfect gentleman. Starring Keri Russell, Jennifer Coolidge and JJ Feild.

programme.desc: Mike Christian is a happily married man who runs into his high school sweetheart Alex and sparks still fly. Mike is determined Alex is his true soul mate, but he signed an iron-clad pre-nuptial agreement and his wife will not let him out of the marriage.

programme.title: BUFFALOED
programme.desc: Set in the underworld of debt-collecting, overachiever and hustler Peg Dahl (Zoey Deutch), finds quick success, making her the target of a violent competitor.

programme.title: Austenland
programme.desc: A woman who is obsessed with "Pride and Prejudice" travels to a Jane Austen theme park in search for her perfect gentleman. Starring Keri Russell, Jennifer Coolidge and JJ Feild.

programme.title: She's Funny That Way
programme.desc: A married Broadway director falls for a prostitute-turned-actress and works to help her advance her career.

programme.title: Love Unleashed
programme.desc: While hosting a puppy party, Hailey meets single father Ryan.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Snipped in the Bud
programme.desc: Abby Knight is a beautiful ex-attorney and proprietor of Bloomers, a quaint Illinois flower shop. Abby crosses paths with an old law school rival, only to find him murdered in his office shortly after their encounter.

programme.title: My Boyfriends' Dogs
programme.desc: A woman's retelling of how she ended up as a runaway bride with three new dogs.

programme.title: Loves Second Chance
programme.desc: When Rose, a passionate fashion stylist in her 30's living in New York, inherits her grandmother's vintage dress shop, she returns to her small hometown to take care of the store.

programme.title: The Perfect Pairing
programme.desc: Influential and anonymous food and wine critic Christina slips on ice and falls while visiting a winery — and no one knows who she is. Single father Michael and his family take her in to help her jog her memory.

programme.title: Appetite for Love
programme.desc: A corporate executive is sent to a small town to re-brand a restaurant as part of a strategic acquisition, but the iconic diner happens to be in her home town where she hasn't been in years.

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Inspiration
programme.desc: Emma's life plan is thrown off course when Paolo must return to Italy to take care of his father and she discovers a new passion for making art accessible to all.

programme.title: Lead With Your Heart
programme.desc: After forgetting his wedding anniversary, Ben Walker scrambles to make a dinner reservation and buy a gift for his wife, Maura. When Ben calls Maura to tell her about the reservation she realizes that she forgot.

programme.title: A Gift of Miracles
programme.desc: A chance encounter between two strangers, through a series of small coincidences, gives one young woman a new perspective on life, love and the world's unexplained marvels.

programme.title: 10 Truths About Love
programme.desc: A thriving romance columnist thinks she has her love life figured out, until her long-time boyfriend breaks up with her. At the same time, her editor hires a new writer to collaborate on her column, and sparks begin to fly as they clash.

programme.title: Marrying Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Elizabeth, a down to earth school teacher and Donovan, a reserved New York businessman, are very different. Which means their engagement and wedding is nothing if unpredictable.

programme.title: Christmas with the Darlings
programme.desc: When an assistant gives her final notice, she is drawn into helping the charming, younger brother of her wealthy boss as he looks after his orphaned nieces and nephew through Christmas.

programme.title: Hearts of Christmas
programme.desc: To the devoted caregivers of the Community Memorial Hospital NICU, every 'premie' heartbeat is a precious gift, and every family whose baby they care for is like their own.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulbs
programme.desc: Dueling neighbours whose Christmas decorating rivalry turns so outrageous, it puts the 'No' in 'Noel' for the small town sponsoring the annual Fete.

programme.title: Angel Falls: A Novel Holiday
programme.desc: Book editor Hannah must work with former rival Ryan to help a potential writer find her way. Angel Anthony reminds them about Christmas spirit and the value of community.

programme.title: We Need a Little Christmas
programme.desc: Julie is juggling being a single mother to a grieving child and facing her first Christmas without her husband when she develops an unexpected friendship with a neighbor.

programme.title: The Holiday Sitter
programme.desc: When Sam, a workaholic bachelor, babysits his niece and nephew before the holidays, he recruits help from their handsome neighbor Jason and finds himself in an unexpected romance.

programme.title: A Christmas Tree Grows in Colorado
programme.desc: Erin is planning the town’s Christmas celebration and must win over firefighter Kevin in order to obtain the beautiful spruce tree from his property for the celebration.

programme.title: Nine Lives of Christmas
programme.desc: After a stray cat adopts Zachary, he meets Marliee and realizes the single life is not as fulfilling as he thought it was.

programme.title: The Mistletoe Inn
programme.desc: Kim Ross, an aspiring romance novelist, finds herself unceremoniously dumped by her soon-to-be-published romance novelist boyfriend, Garth. She decides to take a leap and signs up for a romance writing retreat.

programme.title: Candy Cane Christmas
programme.desc: As Phoebe is searching for a new tradition to lift her holiday spirits, she realizes that it's not the traditions we cherish, but the people with whom we share them.

programme.title: Bavaria's Alpine Kingdom
programme.desc: There are sparkling palaces from ice and snow, like those found in a fairytale. The icy castles are the phenomenal work of Mother Nature but man had a hand in the magnificent stone castles of the region. The spectacular and histrionic mountains of the Bavarian Alps challenge wildlife and the people who live there and the rocky ramparts of this mountain kingdom are built of limestone and fossil rocks that tell of its origins beneath the sea. Millions of visitors from all over the world come to Bavaria every year to witness the mysticism of the landscape. Kings and Queens, tourist and locals, all are welcomed in the fantastic alpine kingdom. Early summer often comes with the threat of storms that bring floods that scour the land and threaten many creatures. But farmers risk these dangers to take their herds to the highest pastures, where they can graze on the sweetest flower-filled meadows. And later from the high-quality milk produced by their herds, the famers make highly prized cheese. Humankind lives among eagle owls, chamoix, wild cats, stoats and ravens up in these mountains.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.desc: A few thousand years ago, there were bare moraine ridges and barren meltwater valleys here. A landscape born in the last ice age, characterized by the edge of the Alps, gentle hills, moors, and lakes. And by cultural richness, not only on the islands in Lake Chiemsee, with their famous monasteries and castles. Long before King Ludwig II, the first people settled in the Chiemgau region. Finds of hunting weapons from the Neanderthal era prove that the land was inhabited even during the ice age, probably because there was plenty of game to hunt. During the Bronze Age, one of the most important trade routes from the mountains to the Alpine foothills passed through here. Then came the Celts and the Romans.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.desc: Three times in the past two decades, the Chiemsee area has experienced "once-in-a-century" floods. Climate, wildlife, and landscape have changed, and it seems this transformation is accelerating. Species living in the flood zones are developing sophisticated survival strategies. Knot ants, for instance, place their queen in the middle and form a raft with their bodies, even conquering new habitats. Flooding is less of a disaster for nature and impacts humans more significantly.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Gironde is the largest and most powerful tidal current in Europe. When the Gironde flows into the Atlantic, it is 15 kilometers wide and in the rhythm of the tides, it brings the waters from the Pyrenees and the Massif Central into the ocean. This often pushes its waters far out into the Gironde at high tide.This creates a world of its own that has shaped everything uniquely and intensely for tens of thousands of years. The water surface of the river is so large that the evaporation has created its own microclimate, which is stable and, together with the brackish waters, has influenced flora and fauna on the right and left of the bank for a long time.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Dordogne consists of a visible and an invisible system of flowing water. Caves and basins under the earth's surface store the excess water and return it to the river when it is dry. A perfect management of a precious resource, not invented by humans, but by the complex nature itself. The result is an ever life-giving river.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 1
programme.desc: Winter means more than just the beginning of the year for the people of Lofoten: For more than a thousand years, Lofoten has been a hub for cod fishing, with seasons lasting from February to April as huge shoals migrate from the Barents Sea to these waters. During these hectic months, more than 65,000 tons of fish are brought to shore, securing the income for the whole of Lofoten for years to come. Around a quarter of the fish caught ends up on lines to dry upon racks. From a young age, the children from the fishing villages get to earn some pocket money by cutting cod tongues and selling the produce as a delicacy appreciated by the locals.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 2
programme.desc: Almost unnoticeably, spring turns into summer. The days become longer and longer, with a never-setting sun. People who have spent their winter and spring working hard can finally enjoy their own nature, even though the temperature is only slightly warmer. Lofoten is sparsely populated, just 24,000 people live here. Unstad is one of its smallest communities with only 15 inhabitants, but despite that, it has become a hotspot for arctic surf and is host to the northern-most surf center in the world. Surfers from all over the globe come to surf in the arctic water.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.desc: The contours of the Mediterranean have changed during the course of its history. Near Gibraltar, Africa was once connected to the European continent. When the land bridge at Gibraltar collapsed, the Mediterranean basin filled up again. The Suez Canal is today connected to the Red Sea. This route enables animals to reach the Mediterranean, where they cause problems.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Rugged rocks, blue sea and idyllic, sandy beaches - this is the Mediterranean as we know it. But this impression is deceptive: the Mediterranean is under constant change. The continents are moving towards one another. Animals, that have to survive under such extreme conditions, must find a way to escape the dangers. Between deserts and volcanoes, the challenges for the animals are enormous.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de Valensole”, our viewers encounter Gérard Blanc, who has been hit particularly hard. The lavender farmer lost sixty percent of his harvest to one tiny insect: the leafhopper. This insect has already destroyed half of the lavender acreage, bumping France from its market position as the world’s top producer of lavender oil. The film visits a resolute farmer who, not about to give up, is testing methods to fend off the voracious insect.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The progress of first cultivation attempts is slow. In India, the rural population, especially, needs affordable, well-tolerated medicine – medicine based on herbs. In Kerala, the film shows a family operation that hand-produces botanical medicine for the local market. High up in the Himalayas, we observe a village healer at work. The science of Ayurvedic medicine is five thousand years old. Today, interest in the ancient healing art is surging, not only in India. In Delhi’s Old Town, the film visits a wholesaler who supplies the booming global herb market, and we take a look inside the laboratories of the largest manufacturer of Ayurvedic medicines in the world. In Kerala, we meet a doctor employed at a small Ayurveda clinic, and in Nordern India, we join a student of Tibetan medicine on a hike up into the mountains, where she prepares for an exam in herbology.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on preserving this invaluable knowledge.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian distillery in Germany, Hubsi digs for protected gentian roots in Berchtesgaden National Park. For yellow gentian is one of the most bitter medicinal herbs in the world, well suited for schnapps and as a general tonic.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for entering and exiting the narrow blossom is strenuous. Within three weeks, maximum, Mladen must remove his bees from the island. Otherwise they will die of exhaustion. In Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, the film visits Iva Yosifova. Hollyhock provides the raw material for her objects of art. The herb is medically beneficial, due to its mucilage, which is added to many cough tea mixtures. Iva, though, makes paper from hollyhock. Thanks to the herb’s long fibres, the paper can be spread onto objects and modeled. The technique produces delicate sculptures, as fragile as nature.

programme.title: Bavaria's Alpine Kingdom
programme.desc: There are sparkling palaces from ice and snow, like those found in a fairytale. The icy castles are the phenomenal work of Mother Nature but man had a hand in the magnificent stone castles of the region. The spectacular and histrionic mountains of the Bavarian Alps challenge wildlife and the people who live there and the rocky ramparts of this mountain kingdom are built of limestone and fossil rocks that tell of its origins beneath the sea. Millions of visitors from all over the world come to Bavaria every year to witness the mysticism of the landscape. Kings and Queens, tourist and locals, all are welcomed in the fantastic alpine kingdom. Early summer often comes with the threat of storms that bring floods that scour the land and threaten many creatures. But farmers risk these dangers to take their herds to the highest pastures, where they can graze on the sweetest flower-filled meadows. And later from the high-quality milk produced by their herds, the famers make highly prized cheese. Humankind lives among eagle owls, chamoix, wild cats, stoats and ravens up in these mountains.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.desc: A few thousand years ago, there were bare moraine ridges and barren meltwater valleys here. A landscape born in the last ice age, characterized by the edge of the Alps, gentle hills, moors, and lakes. And by cultural richness, not only on the islands in Lake Chiemsee, with their famous monasteries and castles. Long before King Ludwig II, the first people settled in the Chiemgau region. Finds of hunting weapons from the Neanderthal era prove that the land was inhabited even during the ice age, probably because there was plenty of game to hunt. During the Bronze Age, one of the most important trade routes from the mountains to the Alpine foothills passed through here. Then came the Celts and the Romans.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.desc: Three times in the past two decades, the Chiemsee area has experienced "once-in-a-century" floods. Climate, wildlife, and landscape have changed, and it seems this transformation is accelerating. Species living in the flood zones are developing sophisticated survival strategies. Knot ants, for instance, place their queen in the middle and form a raft with their bodies, even conquering new habitats. Flooding is less of a disaster for nature and impacts humans more significantly.

programme.title: Jacques Cousteau's Legacy - Return To The Undersea World
programme.desc: A composition of wildlife footage, archive material and elaborate re-enactments results in a brilliant reconstruction of the life of famed marine biologist and environmental pioneer Jacques Cousteau. On the trail of the most famous oceanographer of the 20th Century, the team spent two years filming original locations on three different continents, in four different oceans. The film charts how Cousteau’s outlook on the environment changed throughout his many decades at sea around the globe. On his personal journey to enlightenment, he changed from a man who killed sharks in hate and thoughtlessly blew up coral reefs, to a radical environmentalist.

programme.title: Predators of a Different Kind - In the World of the Unknown Sharks
programme.desc: With the aid of modern technology, reveal the unknown behaviour of some unusual species of shark: lemon sharks and their white-tip reef counterparts. Our film trip begins on the Bahamas. To be more precise: in the turquoise-blue waters of the Grand Bahama Bank, in an exactly fixed location. In the spring, 70 – 80 pregnant lemon sharks arrive here. This huge shark population was first discovered just a few years ago by shark researcher, Professor Sam Gruber. Many of the females are tired and rest on the seabed. Pregnant tiger sharks swim in the midst of this group. Without any protection whatsoever, our cameramen shoot their footage, surrounded by sharks and succeed in capturing images hitherto unseen. We continue our journey to Gainesville, Florida, to meet Gordon Hubbell, the leading shark denture expert with the world’s largest shark denture collection. He knows everything about the evolutionary history of the lemon sharks, in addition to those of the white-tip reef variety off Cocos Island, Costa Rica. Here, we encounter large schools of fish, unprecedented numbers of stingrays, as well as hammerhead sharks. However, it is the white-tip reek sharks that make the biggest impression. Their performance begins late at night. Marauding, they patrol in large groups through the reefs and hunt everything that moves. Scales and dead prey fish float above the reef – a welcoming change of diet for the ubiquitous barracudas.

programme.title: Giants of Fortune - The Whale Sharks of Oslob
programme.desc: In the little Filipino village of Oslob on the Cebu Island, people suffer from typhoons and overfishing. Until the world’s biggest fish and the Internet change everything.Fisherman Zosimo’s dearest wish is for his children to graduate from high school one day. Yet the chance that this wish will come true is tiny, since at times Zosimo doesn’t even manage to feed the family. Typhoons and overfishing make the lives of Oslob fishermen difficult.

programme.title: Symphony of the Seas - Underwater Wonders of Australia's Ocean
programme.desc: Our journeys take us all around the world from Patagonia to the USA, from Greenland to South Africa and from Cambodia to Australia and leads us to the most fascinating places where landscapes animals and humans are the main focus of our documentaries. Whether on land or at sea – the last paradises of the world are our destination.

programme.title: The Last Paradises: Patagonia - Coast of the Killer Whale
programme.desc: On the wild coast of Patagonia, the nature calendar describes the most diverse visiting times of fascinating animals, from the southern right whale and other large whales, via the sea lions and elephant seals up to the orcas and millions of penguins. The encounters with whales and their babies are spectacular. Hardly anywhere else on earth can one experience both the brutal and the delightful sides of nature so vividly and so close. The trip to the hot spots for animal watchers and researchers leads us inter alia to the Caleta Valdez. This is where, during the mating season, the southern elephant seals bring their babies into the world, mate and enjoy a little sunbathing on the beach.

programme.title: Blue Whisper
programme.desc: "Blue Whisper" immerges into the ocean's fascinating underwater world and gets to the bottom of a widely unexplored field of underwater science: The communication amongst fish. The 3D-Documentary accompanies a team of specialists to overwhelmingly beautiful coral reefs, ancient shipwrecks in the Mediterranean Sea and sunken submarines that are clouded in secrecy, to explore the versatile forms of underwater communication. What language do fish use? Do they make sounds? Do they have a body language? And what role do colors play? With the aid of complex underwater video- and audio- equipment those and further questions are answered during a suspenseful journey around the world.

programme.title: Mysterious Oceanic Oases - Hotspots of Life
programme.desc: Countless marine animals frolic on the steep slopes of underwater volcanoes. In many cases, several are rare species not found elsewhere. This is in part due to the fact that plankton clings to the wall and provides the fish with food in abundance. This documentary shows several of these oases and also examines the impact dive tourism has and whether preventive measures can help to maintain them. Nature and underwater filmmaker Rolf Möltgen undertakes dives into the mysterious underwater mountain landscapes with marine scientists from all corners of the globe. This journey takes us to Mexico, to snappers, white-tip reef sharks, Galapagos sharks and giant mantas. We visit the Maldives, Colombia and Costa Rica, where the team documents rare species such as deep sea burbots, small tooth sand tiger and dogfish sharks, in depths of more than 3 metres. The eerie underwater mountain world proves: everyone plays a part in the network of life. Thanks to consistent protective regulations, it has been possible to retain the underwater diversity - especially in the unique oases of the high seas

programme.title: Billion Dollar Fish
programme.desc: They are virtually unchanged from their ancestors, who swam in ancient rivers when the dinosaurs still ruled the planet. Their unfertilised eggs became black gold, served in only the most expensive restaurants as caviar. This ancient giant is the Beluga Sturgeon, considered by some to be the largest freshwater fish in the world. Sturgeons are now at the very edge of extinction because of the exclusive market for their eggs, but only the eggs can allow the species to live. Paradoxically, the desire for caviar may now be the only chance they have for their future existence.

programme.title: Penguin City - South Georgia
programme.desc: In the middle of the Antarctic Ocean, an entire mountain range arises from the water: South Georgia, the nursery of the Antarctic. Hundreds of thousands of penguins, elephant seals, fur seals and their young overcrowd the beaches. The rough weather and the extremely difficult access to the island cause filmmaking to be an endeavor requiring much of the film crew around Roland Gockel and Rosie Koch and the state of the art cameras. A lot of patience and sensitivity over a period spanning some five years now offers unknown and poignant insights into the life of the King Penguins on South Georgia Island

programme.title: Strandwolf
programme.desc: She moves through the seal colony on Namibia’s wild Skeleton Coast with purpose and focus, gingerly stepping around the adults who snap at her heels. She’s searching for smaller prey. Following her is a young German field scientist, Ingrid Wiesel, who has now spent 17 years with Tosca’s clan; tracking, observing, and learning everything she can about one of the world’s least understood and most unusual predators.

programme.desc: Join Andreas Kieling and a native Alaskan on a dangerous expedition through Alaska’s grizzly territories.
